etymology.description: 行 ‘carry out; do’ + 动 ‘move’ = take action; be in motion/operation.
etymology.interpretation: Combines carrying out (行) with movement (动) to express acting or putting plans into motion. Also used attributively, especially in Taiwan, to mean mobile/portable.
etymology.simplification: 動 → 动 by replacing 重 with 云 and retaining 力, reducing strokes; 行 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们需要立即采取行动(我們需要立即採取行動)。
examples.english: We need to take action immediately.

examples.chinese: 他的行动非常迅速(他的行動非常迅速)。
在台湾，手机常叫行动电话(在臺灣，手機常叫行動電話)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Táiwān, shǒujī cháng jiào xíngdòng diànhuà.
examples.english: In Taiwan, mobile phones are often called xíngdòng diànhuà.
